symptoms.name: Abdominal colic
symptoms.pattern: Associated with vomiting and intermittent diarrhea

symptoms.name: Postural hypotension
symptoms.pattern: Systolic blood pressure drop on standing

vital_signs.blood_pressure: Supine: 150/100 mmHg; Standing: 60 mmHg systolic (diastolic unrecordable); Later: Supine 110/70 mmHg, Standing 100/56 mmHg

physical_findings: Small pupils, sluggishly and symmetrically reacting to light and accommodation
No cerebellar signs or peripheral nerve thickening
No superficial or deep sensory loss, hyperaesthesias or trunkal sensory level

lab_values.nerve_conduction_studies: Essentially normal except for absent F-response on peroneal nerve stimulation in the 3rd week

required: Acute or subacute onset of autonomic dysfunction following mumps infection
supportive: Abnormal autonomic tests (e.g., absent sympathetic skin response, abnormal Valsalva ratio, no heart rate response to standing)
Possible sensory symptoms and absent F-response in peroneal nerve suggesting proximal somatic nerve involvement

differential_diagnoses: Other causes of autonomic dysfunction (as listed in Table I of the source article)
